location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The letters in the file are arranged in chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation is in pencil, circled, and can be found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. The numbering commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the last folio with 53. The remains of an original pagination sequence is also present in the file between ff 2-53; these numbers are written in ink.

mods.abstract: The volume consists of correspondence sent to and from the Bushire Residency; the principal correspondents being Major Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf at the time, and John Croft Hawkins, Commodore commanding the Squadron in the Gulf of Persia, on board the East India Company Sloop Clive. The main topic covered is piracy.
